page.title: 12ST.ANDREWS PARK AND TOMB
page.content: {St.Andrew's Park}is in the Parish of { {St.Helier.}It is used for a play area and has a few climbing frames and swings. In the corner of the park is{ {St.Andrew's Church.}The park and the church were dedicated to St. Andrew, a poor fisherman. The park and church were first built because of a seamen's mission. They were started in 1850 and completed in 1854. Ships needing ballast used to send carts to the dunes for sand. One day in {1865,}while sand was being taken, some {stones}were uncovered. Archaeologists later recognised these as parts of a {prehistoric tomb.}They were not fully uncovered until 1883, but now you can see them in{St. {Andrew's Park.}They were proved to be {two tombs}of entirely different types.
